text: Bottle @ home. Black. Smells chocolate, sweet, vanilla, roasty, lovely. Tastes roasty, vanilla, chocolate. Great beer. Full body, soft carbo, silky.

330ml bottle. Jet black colour with average, thick, creamy, moderately lasting and lacing, beige to tan head. Roasty, dark malty aroma, notes of mocha, dark chocolate, cocoa, hints of brown sugar, a touch of orange, some liquorice and malt lozenge. Taste is sweet-ish dark malty, notes of mocha, espresso, cocoa, hints of brown sugar, a nuttily touch, some liquorice; oily texture, smooth and minimally sticky palate. Insistently present, but not overdone, integrated and balanced mocha notes. Very good.
I can¬ít think of any characteristic of this beer that distinguished it from the styles standards for the better or for the worse... and that¬ís probably for the worse

330ml bottle. Pours black with a two finger tan head. Aroma: coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, caramel. Taste: mirrors the aroma, lots of coffee and chocolate, roasted malts, quite sweet, dried fruits, caramel/toffee notes, dry bitter coffee finish. Medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, moderate carbonation. Lovely flavours, initial sweetness is pretty intense.
Black, beige head. Roasty, chocolate, coffee, malts. Sweet roasty bitterness, mild creamy mouthfeel. Dry. Nice flavours but a bit thin.

Red Eye Flight de chez Tempest en Ecosse est un Porter brass√© avec du cacao, du sucre demerara et des grains de caf√© italiens grill√©s. Vers√©e dans un verre, c¬íest une bi√®re √† la robe brune sombre pour une mousse cr√©meuse et beige. Au nez, elle d√©gage des ar√¥mes de malt grill√©, de caf√©, de chocolat, de sucre brun et de caramel. En bouche, on y retrouve des saveurs de chocolat, de caf√©, de caramel, d¬í√©pices et de fruits secs. Son corps est lisse et sa carbonatation l√©g√®re pour un final sec et subtilement amer. 
Amertume 3/5
Douceur 3/5
Bottle at home.Black colour with medium beige head.Aroma of cocoa and roasted coffee beans,malty and and hoppy with good taste of caramel and slight oak,well balanced and smooth finish.

A bit disappointed by this tempest. Very standard and monotonous porter, body is a bit too light. Nose and attack are only around coffee, but the "porter kind", the use of real beans brings nothing special, no complexity.
Minimal top. Carbonation is almost flat. Aroma a bit too shy. Nice mouthfeel. Kind of silky. Well balanced taste.

Nice beige brown head. Quite intensive aroma of coffee, chocoate, cocoa, crust of bread. Taste is full of coffee, chocolate and ends with high bitterness. Carbonation is far too high. Dry. Really tasty beer.

Kolor ca≈Çkowicie czarny, nieprzejrzysty. W aromacie dominuje bardzo mocna, szlachetna kawa, w tle tak≈ºe ciemna czekolada i nieco karmelu. W smaku podobnie - intensywnie kawowe, nieco czekoladowe. Goryczka chmielowo-kawowa, przyjemna. Pije siƒô powoli ale z przyjemno≈õciƒÖ.
Barwa czarna, piana ma≈Ça. Aromat czekolady, kawy, kakao. W smaku p√≥≈Çs≈Çodki a po chwili lekko kwa≈õny od posmaku kawy. Lekko popio≈Çowa goryczka . Fajne pifko.

Aromat: mocny i intensywny, kawa, gorzka czekolada, ziarna kakaowca.
WyglƒÖd: perfekcyjny, czarne, smoliste, piƒôkna warstwa centymetrowa, be≈ºowej piany, utrzymujƒÖca siƒô jeszcze jaki≈õ czas.
Smak: bardzo mocno kawa, r√≥≈ºne rodzaje czekolady- gorzka, mleczna, taka z kawƒÖ, opr√≥cz tego trochƒô kakao i palonych s≈Çod√≥w. G≈Çadkie i zbalansowane, na finiszu gorzka czekolada i trochƒô kawowej cierpko≈õci, lekkie ale nie wodniste, goryczka kawowa, chwilkƒô zalega, ale nie jest zbyt mocna. Brakuje mi tu posmaku suszonej ≈õliweczki bo a≈º siƒô prosi o to w tym piwie. Czuƒá ≈ºe u≈ºyto kawy najwy≈ºszej jako≈õci, to ona jest motywem przewodnim tego piwa. Raczej wytrawne, s≈Çodycz od gorzkiej czekolady, ma≈Ço nut karmelowych. Bardzo dobry, kawowy, nieulepkowy porter.
Bottle from Martin¬ís. Pours black with tan head. Lots of coffee, chocolate and caramel. Smooth, drinkable and a dry dark chocolate finish. Very tasty.
Bottle at home. Pours black with a big tan head. Aroma has strong cocoa and coffee. Taste has sweet chocolate, espresso bitterness and some malts. Pretty nice.
A: Dark brown coloured with a huge offwhite head N: ash, oak, smoke, coffee T: Espresso, ash, hickory, oak O: Wow! Did not expect it to be this good! Smokey and VERY nice coffee flavours!

(bottle, 33cl) Hazy, very dark brown colour with a short and tanned foamy head. Very coffee-centric aroma with notes of grounded coffee beans. Roasty bitter flavour, medium bodied with a very smooth carbonation. Roasty mocha-laden taste with traces of dark chocolate and a roast-bitter and delicately sweet finish. Surely likeable but also a bit one-dimensional. 27.III.17
330ml bottle. Pours black without head. Coffee, chocolate, raisins, little brandy heat. Little one dimensional but nice enough.

330ml bottle. Pours jet black with one finger creamy tan head. Caramel, toffee, bitter chocolate, freshly ground coffee beans, treacle, licorice, plum, fig....etc pretty complex a lot going on here! Wonderful medium thick creamy smooth in the mouth. Lovely roasted chocolate malt taste first, followed by that fantastic coffee and bitter chocolate. Dark dried fruits, raisin, plum, fig next. Finishes with a nice blast of dry hop bitterness, and that amazing roasted malt and coffee mellowing around the mouth nicely. One of the best Porters I¬ív had. Stunning.

The aroma is full of chocolate, coffee, caramel, roasted malts, coffee beans and cocoa nibs. The color is pitch black and no head is present. The taste is full of chocolate, coffee, caramel, roasted malts, coffee beans, cocoa nibs and vanilla. A nice beer!
Robe brune mousse marron. Nez caf√©, chocolat, malt grill√©. Identique en bouche. Tr√®s bonne.
Bottle. Super black, brown head. Perfumed roast and milk chocolate aroma, medium full, oily mouthfeel, strong roast, coffee flavor, dry chocolate retronasal.
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Nose is chocolate, coffee, toast, caramel, bread. Palate is leathery, chocolate, coffee. Great porter.
Black with brown head. Aroma is moccha, coffee, roast, espresso. Taste is bitter coffe with some dark chocolate sweetness. Very smooth but not my type of beer.

Bottle. Darkest brown color with beige head. Aroma is chocolate, espresso, very aromatic. Taste is espresso ground, black chocolate, truffes. Super-silky mouthfeel. Super-balanced and still flavourful. Excellent!

Keg at Casc. Pours black with tight n creamy light-tan head. Aromas of dusty, boozy dark chocolate, grain, prunes and a boozy vapour. Flavour has dusted dark chocolate truffles, a deep dark roasted malt, a little hazelnut praline and soft vanilla. A glossy, smooth mouthfeel with a gentle but sharp sparkle. This is one lovely smooth luxurious roasty porter. Enough heft to feel like a treat.

Po nalaniu tworzy siƒô ≈õrednia, drobna piana, kt√≥ra do≈õƒá szybko opada do chmurki. Barwa prawie czarna, nieprzejrzysta. W aromacie przyjemnie kawowy, kakaowy, czekoladowy. W smaku p√≥≈Çs≈Çodki, tu r√≥wnie≈º dominuje lekko s≈Çonawa czekolada, kawa, palony melasa, rodzynki (z utlenienia?). Goryczka niska do ≈õredniej, palona, popio≈Çowa. Wysycenie niskie do ≈õredniego, fajnie pe≈Çne a przy tym nie≈∫le pijalne w odbiorze.

Jeden z fajniejszych Porter√≥w, dor√≥wnujƒÖcy Mikkeller Porter.

Negro intenso con peque√±a cabeza de espuma beige de ligera retenci√≥n; aromas a caf√©, especias, caramelo y malta torrefacta; en boca entrada media, maltosa, licorosa con amargor medio, m√°s proveniente de la malta negra que de el l√∫pulo, notas a caramelo tofe, cuerpo medio pleno con bajo carb√≥nico, largo retrogusto, maltoso y ligeramente amargo, cerveza compleja y rica en matices.

D√©couverte dans la Saveur Box. Bi√®re noire avec tr√®s belle mousse brune. Au nez on retrouve le malt, le chocolat et le caf√©. En bouche les ar√¥mes se confirment. Tr√®s belle et bonne bi√®re. Belle d√©couverte et bonne d√©gustation.

Bottle at The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a deep brown to black colour with a frothy mocha head. 
Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, cocoa, some brown sugar, slight liquorice, a little smoke and subtle caramel. Taste of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, some liquorice, slight caramel, a little brown sugar and subtle earth. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dryish, roasted coffee bitterness in the finish. Nice, the closet you can get to a mocha. Lots of roasted coffee, chocolate and a hint of brown sugar.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017 33cl bottle. Thanks Adam. Pours near black with a thin brown head. Ashy, roasted malt in aroma. Some oatmeal. Oatmeal, licorice, spicy notes, roastedness, ash in flavor. Pretty dry finish. Coffee cones through later quite strong.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2017 tap/artefakt. czarne, niewielki krƒÖzek, brƒÖzowej, drobnopƒôcherzykowej piany. aromat ≈õwie≈ºo zaparzonej kawy, czekolady, s≈Çod√≥w palonych. w smaku kawa r√≥wnie≈º dominuje, goryczka od s≈Çod√≥w palonych na podniebieniu utrzymuje siƒô d≈Çu≈ºszƒÖ chwilƒô. mega piwo
33 cl. bottle. A black beer with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, hops, coffee, cocoa and a bitterness.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, mocha, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight/medium brown/dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, chocolate and mocha; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Very mild and balanced flavour, especially for everything they added and its abv. Still, the mocha and coffee are really delicate. Amazing appearance and a nice creamy palate. The aroma could have been stronger.

(bottle) deep brown in colour with a frothy beige head. aroma of green bell peppers and cold-pressed coffee, with some notes of sugar icing and gletscherprise. flavour is mostly toasted malts and yeast slurry, with lots of earth, dark chocolate, sugar icing and a slightly ethanolic finish. heavy-bodied with average carbonation.

En versant on pourrait croire √† du jus de goudron tellement c¬íest dark. Mousse brun√¢tre bien comme il faut. Vachement ax√©e sur le caf√© de prime abord, elle se trouve en fait bien √©quilibr√©e avec des notes de caramel, de toffee et de chocolat en renfort. En bouche c¬íest super doux, presque liquoreux, mais juste doux et bien rond. Moi qui ne suis habituellement pas fan du genre, je trouves que c¬íest un bon nectar.

15/20 big initial coffee hit followed by long chocolate and caramel aftertaste. Great alcohol hit, pretty balanced. It's a mocha porter and does what it says on the tin

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Jet black with a lovely dark coffee-coloured head. Aroma of freshly-ground mild coffee. Bold coffee taste. Delicious.

Alluring aroma in a solid black pour. Nicely balanced hop/malt flavor profile with an enticing kick of coffee and a subtle hint of chocolate (and licorice). An excellent example of the style (Mocha Porter).
Bottle from McHughs. Black with a small tan head. Aroma of ground coffee. Flavour is malt, dark coffee, bitter chocolate, dark fruit finish.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2017 Draught.
Black colored with a medium sized off-white head.
Roasted aroma of caramel and coffee with notes of chocolate.
Roasted flavor of caramel and chocolate with notes of hops.
Roasted finish.

Sweet and roasted malty aroma and taste, big prominent coffee aroma and tatse, big dark thick velvety chocolate into the finish. :)

Draft @ Inferno, Copenhagen. Pours a dark amber ruby black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty chocolate aroma with hints of coffee. Roasted malty chocolate and coffee flavor. Has a roasted malty dry bitter chocolate and coffee finish.

Czarne z przeciƒôtnƒÖ pianƒÖ. W aromacie s≈Çodko, czekolada, kawa, espresso, mokka, tiramisu, toffi. S≈Çodkie, lekko palone, sporo kawy i czekolady. Goryczka ≈õrednia. Cia≈Ço przeciƒôtne. Ca≈Çkiem ok, choƒá wg mnie za du≈ºo tu s≈Çodyczy, nawet jak na porter.

Bottle at home. Black pour, thin tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, caramel, bread, chocolate and mocha. Flavor is quite dry and slightly bitter, roasted and well balanced. Very clean brew. Lovely.

Keg Third of a Pint at BrewDog, Camden, London in Jan 2016 - Very Dark Brown / Black in colour. Good creamy light brown head. Good lacing. Very Malty; roasty malts, lots of coffee, espresso, dark chocolate, toffee. Fruity; dark fruit notes. Hoppy; piney hops, balancing hop bitterness. Sweet-bitter roast coffee chocolate malty and fruity throughout. Very Tasty. Nice Coffee Porter! (2016-01-27)

From backlog. Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, espresso, vanilla, a bit of smoke, cacao, chocolate and nuts. Bitter finish with roasted malts, espresso, nuts, chocolate, cacao and dark fruits. Excellent porter.

Piana drobna, be≈ºowa, do≈õƒá trwa≈Ça. Aromat niezbyt wyra≈∫ny, ziarna kawy, czekolada. W smaku dalej ≈õwie≈ºo otwarta paczka kawy, mocno palone, trochƒô opiekane, generalnie agresywne. Nasycenie ≈õrednie w stronƒô wysokiego, nieco za wysokie imho. Brakuje mi tu troszkƒô cia≈Ça. Alkohol niewyczuwalny. Udane piwo, tylko raczej nie w moim gu≈õcie.
Bottle @ home, thanks Klim! Blackish pour with a hefty tan head. Notes of roast, fresh coffee, light cocoa, some caramel and a moderate bitterness.

Bottle. It pours jet black with a beige head. The aroma is roasted malts and roasted coffee beans. Light nutty. The flavor is mainly roasted coffee with some milky creamy notes. Roasted finish. Nicely joined up coffee Porter.

Bottle @ Tidens Farver, Aarhus. Pours black with a small brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, expresso, caramel, light chocolate, light nut. Flavor is light sweet, malt, caramel, coffee, dark chocolate, light smoke. Medium body, average to lively carbonation. 201216

Pours very dark brown with fading tan head. Aroma has dark malts, roasted notes, chocolate and coffee. Taste is semi-sweet roasted malt, with complex chocolate and coffee notes. Finish is balanced sweet, malty and dry.

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Chocolate and coffee make this beer. It¬ís quite smooth and very tasty

Belle roebe d¬íun noire profond, peu de mousse. Nez intense de cocolat, caf√© et malts grill√©s. Belle amertume, saveurs de caf√©, caf√© au lait, chocolat, finale am√®re de houblons. Corps rond et l√©g√®rement granuleux, tr√®s belle longueur. Une tr√®s bonne porter aux ar√¥mes de caf√© puissants.
Bottle 0.33l at home, Riihim√§ki. BB APR 2017. Colour is dark brown with small brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Chocolate, coffee, some sweetness, cocoa and roasted malts.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a small light bubbly dark brown head. Aromas of coffee, sweet chocolatey malt, light ashy bitterness. Taste is roasty, light ashy, bitter coffee, sweet bready malt, chocolate, dark fruits.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and licorice. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish. Oily, soft and smooth. 121216
Duft soja cacao m√¶rk kant lakrissaltlakris smag m√∏rk malt chokolade kaffe dyb smag ristet eftersmag soja salt lakrids

Bottled. Pours deep brown nearly black wit a small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, vanilla and licorice notes. Sweet flavor that ends up being dry and slightly bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Porter. üåüüåüüåüüåü

Draught. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Some nice licorice notes. Heavy biter wonderfull flavior. Nice licorice notes. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Excellent.

Bottle, 7.4%. Very dark brown with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, espresso and vanilla. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, cocoa, little espresso, vanilla, medium sweet, hop, liquorice and a little bitter.

Bottle. Sensoric. Deep brown with medium, off-white to beige, thick head. Moderate head retention and lacing. Aroma is mainly roasted malts - wet, freshly ground coffee (very nice), chocolate and wood. Moderately malty profile (roasted malts and bread), mildly ashy. Taste is light to moderately sweet with quite strong bitterness, along with this nice coffee dryness and acidic. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation, finish is dry, coffee, medium lasting, roasted and chocolate. In general very good coffee based porter. Beautifully balanced and decent.

Aroma is big coffee and roasted malts. A very rich coffee roast on the nose. Taste is dominantly roasted coffe beans, but also light chocolate and malty sweetness. There¬ís a fair share of hop bitterness popping up here as well.

Draft. A black beer with a brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, bread, and chocolate. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, chocolate, and a bit of bread, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle 33cl. poured into a shaker. Pitch black, good two finger tan head, half-way lasting, good lacing; coffee nose, rich aroma roasted malts, cocoa, mocha, coffee, brown sugar; taste medium sweet and bitter, malty, chocolate, espresso; smooth sweetbitter aftertaste, lingering chocolate and coffee in the finish; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; rich and round porter, excellent.

moccha porter, 7.4%, schenkt donker bruin tot zwart met fijne mooie bruine kraag, aroma van asbak, sigaar, mocco, zwart geblakerde mout, Smaken van sigaren tabak, maar vooral een enorme hoeveelheid aan gebrande koffiebonen, cacao, espresso, droog, redelijke body, lage co2, matig zoet, enorme shitload aan gebrande koffie bonen, overall ok ... als je door de koffie bonen het bier nog kan zien...

dark brown colour, moderate sized creamy beige head; aroma of heavy roasted coffee beans, ash, burnt sunflower seeds, hints of soy sauce, leather and herbal notes; taste is dominated by coffee with herbal, burnt nutty and ash notes; not bad, but still I¬ím not 100% convinced

Aroma: very good aromas of roasted and toasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, oats. Medium intensity of aroma.
Appearance: very dark brown color, almost black, with much above average head thickness. Light brown head with very good retention. Very good appearance. Very low Brussels¬í lacing, almost inexistent. To dark to tell for sure but it seems pretty clear.
Taste: light sweetness, medium bitterness, no sourness. Very well balanced.
Palate: medium body, oily-to-creamy texture, soft carbonation, very long dry bitter finish of roasted malts, coffee and dark chocolate, cocoa and mocha. The high alcohol level causes a little noticeable warming effect.
Overall: nice appearance and very good aromas and flavors of roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolates, cocoa, mocha, espresso, oats. Coffee flavor is the most noticeable. Very long dry finish with the same intense flavors. Very pleasant. A very good Porter I¬íd drink again.

black, medium long-lasting light brown foam; chocolate, coffee, roasty aroma; medium sweetness, light+ bitterness; medium body, smooth feel, average carbonation, long bitterish dry finish
Overall: very good

From 330ml bottle. Pours dark, almost black. Retains a small latte coloured head. Aroma is dark chocolate and spicy dark fruits. Taste is chocolate and coffee, at first sweet but with a bitter finish. Smooth body. Another good one from Tempest

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Color negro, espuma beige, sabor torrefacto, notas chocolate, cafe.

300ml bottle courtesy from Chris (cheers mate) poured into chalice glass. Deep black in colour with a thick tan head. Aroma is very malty with intense notes of freshly ground coffee, long in intensity. Thin oily mouthfeel and poor lacing. Dark malt complex provides maltloaf base with rich flavours of black coffee, dark Ecuadorean chocolate and molasses full on in the mouth. Very little in the way of hop resins survive in the non existent bitter aftertaste. Finish is very smooth and malty with the strong coffee bean flavours still percolating in the mouth, along with dark chocolate and sweet molasses adding a sweeter element to proceedings. A lovely rich and complex Porter, would love to try this on cask along with a few others from the extensive portfolio!

Draft at Taps, Changkat. Black with a tan head. Aroma of coffee, roast, lactose, light dark chocolate, caramel and toffee. Flavour is above moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Small bottle, served in teku. Pours deep black with nice beige head. Aroma full of coffee beans, black malts, caramel and cocoa. Oily texture, lots of coffee and chocolate, some roastiness, especially in aftertaste. Well-balanced and long finish. No discernible alcohol, full-coffee beer. Enjoyable, but not too drinkable.

Clear, black, small head, nice lacing. Aroma: lots of coffee beans, chocolate, cocoa. Medium to low sweetness, medium body. Lots of coffee in flavour, also some caramel. Nice hidden alcohol. Overall dominated by coffee.

Moka porter dont la recette semble avoir quelque peu chang√© depuis mon exemplaire, √† moins que
ce soit l¬íinverse¬†?? Toujours est-il que mon √©tiquette mentionnait bien 7,4 % abv, mais 50 ebu au
lieu de 60 sur le site. Le houblon √©tait stipul√© comme des USA, mais pas le simcoe sp√©cifiquement.
Dans ma composition on parle bien d¬íune infusion de cacao et caf√© arabica, mais pas du sucre demerara. Malts d¬íorge et de bl√© r√¥tis, avoine.
Mon exemplaire avait un mois d e plus que sa date.
Couleur noire comme du charbon, √† l¬íopacit√© quasi totale.
Mousse qui est un nappage brun fonc√©, assez soyeux.
Ar√¥mes de malt grill√©, caf√©, pointe de seigle, cacao, √©corce de bouleau.
1√®re bouche souple √† l¬íentame malt grill√©, baies noires, pointe d¬íanis √©toil√© d√©licate.
Arri√®re-bouche avec une belle amertume (n¬íoublions pas les 50 ebu, qui sont peut-√™tre maintenant 60, ou l¬íinverse??).
2√®me √† la tr√®s belle progression, les saveurs sont plus fondues.
Arri√®re-bouche complexe et longue, plut√¥t sur le caf√©.
3√®me o√π on sent des grains de caf√© r√©ellement.
Arri√®re-bouche √† la qualit√© d¬íun excellent arabica.
Longueur aux belles nuances grains/malt/caf√©/chocolat noir avec malgr√© tout un tr√®s l√©ger fl√©chissement de l¬íharmonie.
Jambes assez huileuses.
Levure souple et forte, belle ligne.
Alcool tr√®s correct, il assure sur la longueur, mais ne peut √©viter le petit couac.
Finale qui reprend des couleurs, si on peut dire...
CONCLUSION¬†: red eye nous sert un tr√®s joli panel caf√©/malt torr√©fi√©, mais flanche un peu sur 
la longueur par faute d¬íinattention (normal avec les yeux rouges !!), pour revenir en beaut√© en finale... Il faut absolument que je contr√¥le la version actuelle de cette bi√®re, et la retester au besoin
si elle correspond bien au descriptif sur le site. A suivre ..

Bottle, pours pitch black with high beige head. Aroma of fresh and very aromatic coffee, roasted malt and... well there is not much more. I love the coffee aroma but the brew is absolutly dominated by roast notes. Also in taste there is a domination of roasty bitterness. I¬ím missing a bit some sweeter notes but still it¬ís a nice brew.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark opaque brown pour with a creamy deep tan head, aroma has mocha and dark fruits, taste has rich espresso coffee, chocolate, sweet sugars, light roast, milky finish.

Barwa ciemnobrƒÖzowa. Piwo klarowne z ≈ÇadnƒÖ jasnobe≈ºowƒÖ pianƒÖ. W aromacie bardzo g≈Çƒôboki, bogaty aromat szlachetnej kawy, nieco palone i pra≈ºone. W smaku dominuje ≈õwie≈ºo zmielona kawa, ziarna kawy, tak≈ºe nuty palone i karmelowe. Goryczka ≈õrednia w stronƒô niskiej, zag≈Çuszona totalnie przez kawƒô. Piwo bardzo g≈Çadkie w ustach i wytrawne.
Great, luxurious, rich, coffee and chocolate brew. The coffee bean aromas are massive. The palate is sooooo smooth and silky. Great beer.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Red Eye Flight by Tempest Brewing Co at JabeerwockyMilo pelny, popiolowy kapke, mocno kawowy, tez czekolada taka troche bombonierkowa, niezbyt wytrawny, pasi mi mocnoOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, coffee, 
Appearance-black, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Bottle. Pours almost black with nice creamy beige head. Aroma is great coffee mixed with some chocolate and roasted malts, which is just great. In taste medium sweet, coffee chocolate and touch of sweet caramel nicely mixed. Medium body, soft carbonation, finish is bit roasty from coffee. Great base beer mixed with good coffee, whata brew.

7.4%ABV. Mocha Porter.

Tapped out black. 40¬∫SRM.

Nose has coffee, charcoal and a nice roasted nuttiness. Vanilla and burnt milk. Hint of soy in the nose.

Mouthfeel is watery and more like stout. Palate has a pleasant light chocolate, raisins, fruit preserves, finishes off with the bitter profile of charcoal, burnt twigs, charred straw.

Finish is stout like with some smoke.

It¬ís all about coffee in aroma, some chocolate and roasted malts in the background. Pours black with tan head. Taste is medium sweet with some sourness from coffee, some citrus and chocolate notes. Medium bitter finish, medium to full body. Overall very enjoyable with high quality coffee.

Pitch black, non-transparent. One finger brown head to it. Super amazing coffee aroma. Coffee completely owns it. Taste is more complex, more devided into coffee, chocolate, roasted malts and roasted, toasted, burned notes. It¬ís very smooth and velvety. Medium body, might have it a big bigger, but still it¬ís really nice. Long, coffee, roasted aftertaste with pleasant bitterness. Awesome beer!

Aroma: mocha coffee, roasted dark malts.
Appearance: jet black and brown head.
Taste: roasted dark malts, milk chocolate, mocha coffee, smooth, earthy, quite dry, weak cocoa notes.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, roasted coffee finish.
Overall: Really good stuff, nice roasted notes and coffee aroma.

330ml bottle from Dobbies Garden Centre - Near black body, foamy lasting tan head, Aroma is coffee, burnt chocolate, mocha. Taste has a sweetness with lots of dark and rich coffee, dark chocolate, earth. Solid mouthfeel, nice and creamy. Quality.

Smell: sweet sweet dark chocolate and roast Arabica coffee

Taste: taste like how it smell.. bitter sweet chocolate and coffee. Dark chocolate aftertaste. Smooth and medium bodied.

Like it.. recommended!

Pours black color, clear, with foamy lasting light brown head. Aroma: rich, intense coffee, roadted and dark (chocolate) malts aroma, which takes on coffee, bittersweet chocolate, cocoa powder. Flavour: similar to aroma: intense coffee aroma, supported with dark/roasted malts, and with hint of hops, which takes on pine, some citruses. Finish is slightly bitter. Body is medium, texture soft, carbonation is low.
Dark brown body with a medium beige brown head. Aroma is chocolate, wood, vanilla, coffee. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with oily texture and soft carbonation. Nice.
Black with mocha cream head. Strong mocha aroma. Great mocha taste with sweet caramel and roasted malt notes. Lasting chocolate aftertaste.

33cl bottle at home from thebeershop-online.com. Nose is cocoa, roasted malt, light smoke. Body is pitch black, head is small, brownish, creamy, mostly diminishing, good lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, smoked wood, herbs, tobacco. Light sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty medium bitter. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Not too heavy, could be sweeter, not bad.

A black beer, a head is small and dark beige. Aroma has strong and aromatic coffee, balanced sweetness and some chocolate. Taste has strong maltyness, balanced coffee, some chocolate, and balancing bitterness. Medium bodied, low carbonation, smooth palate. The great, rich and balanced coffee but that isn¬ít too dominating. Also other flavours are nicely rich. The very tasteful beer.
bottle. Dark brown with small tan head. Roasted malts and coffee aroma. Ashy, coffee flavour

Bottled. More or less black colour with a mediumsized beigeish brown head, that leaves some lace. Aroma is coffee, some roasted malts, a bit sugary notes. Flavour is quite similar in a very nice balanced. Roasted, coffeeish and mildly ashy notes in finish. Beautifully balanced.

Keg at Brewdog Shep¬ís bush. A pitch black coloured pour with a a creamy mid tan head. Aroma is rich creamy coffee, smooth roast, wood, dark chocolate. Flavour is composed of smooth rich creamy coffee, amaretto, maciatto, dark choc, vanilla. Palate is smooth and creamy, velvety smooth, slight bitter finish. I really like the balance of this beer. Very rich but still very drinkable.
33cl bottle. Pitch black with a tan head. Roasted malts, cold coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa and bitter cherries. Hoppy aftertaste. Perfectly balanced.

Courtesy of Jaghana. Couleur noire, aucune mousse. Nez grain de caf√© avec chocolat. Gout d¬íexpresso, caf√© torr√©fi√©, avec chocolat et note de caf√© moulu et r√©glisse. Corps un peu huileux. Fin longue sur le caf√© expresso.

Brown bottle, 330ml, pours brown with a mocha tan head subsiding slowly. Scent is super spicy/peppery, roasted coffee beans? Taste is dense roasted beans, maybe both coffee and chocolate. Cayenne pepper I think. Mouthfeel is medium dense and light caramel, very light sticky. Good beer, not my favorite flavor profile though.

Bottle 33cl a dark beer with low head and carbonation. Nose is intense on dark coffee, coffee beans, licorice and dark chocolate. Aroma is again very intense on roasted malt, dark coffee, dark chocolate, medium creamy, excellent chocolate bouquet especially at the finish where the dark chocolate notes remains properly and long as for a 80% dark chocolate itself. Notes of beans as there, touch of licorice wood and vanilla, espresso. Very nice one, easily drinkable.

Bottle from Saveur. Pours black with tan head. Roasted aroma with big coffee bean/grind notes, chocolate and light green pepper. Dark chocolate taste with some coffee, liquorice and some light hints of vanilla. Short, bitter, coffee finish. Quite light and dry. Very nice!

Bottle at home. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is big fresh roasted coffee, chocolate, slight ash, earth. Taste is big coffee, dark chocolate, very slight citrus, roast, dry finish and a nice kick.
Bottle from appellation wines. Pours opaque very dark brown. Aromas of chocolate malts, coffee grind. Taste is full bodied, resiny sweetness comes through, very dry coffee taste. Lovely

Black body stable head. Creamy mocha like aroma, rye bread, light herbal. Very full, deep flavours, especially considering its quite dry. Short aftertaste but that makes you keep drinking. Lovely beer, so tasty! (33cl bottle from Saveur Bi√®re)

Bottle at Taps Beer Bar, Changkat, Kuala Lumpur. Poured an opaque dark brown with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is grainy earthy mineral coffee. The flavour is moderate liqourice bitter with a smooth rich heavy, roasty malt, liqourice, chocolate, light alcohol, light sweet fruit, light spicy hop palate and a lingering bitter finish. Full bodied with soft carbonation.
bottle scura buona schiuma caffe macinato discrete tostature non molto corpo alcool nascosto media luppolatura

330ml bottle from Firma-Bier. BBE Apr 16. Pours pitch black with a thick light brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, lactic notes, espresso, coffee, chocolate and hints of vegetables. Taste is smooth, roasty and slightly lactic with some espresso, coffee, berries and hints of chocolate. Finish is smooth, slightly roasty and heavy with coffee and cocoa notes. Okay.
Great coffee and chocolate aroma, the coffee gives a great bitterness, high is slightly overbalanced by a touch of lactose. Very tasty

0,33l bottle at home shared by Saeglopur, big thanks. BB 09.04.2016. black color, small dark-coffee-colored head. smells of coffee, coffee-grounds, bitter herbs, light charcoal, light notes of bitter chocolate. nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of coffee grounds, bitter herbal, coffee in general, earthy, ashy, some vanilla, licorice, a bit medical. finishes rather roasted with notes of coffee grounds, some herbal bitterness and vanilla. This one doesnt work for me. Usually I am a sucker for all kinds of dark beers, but this one has too much bitter / roasted coffee notes not much else, also too much vanilla. Wouldnt drink this again.

330 ml bottle from Firma Bier.
Dark brown body, with a quite small, dense, creamy, dark beige head.
Aroma of coffee beans, caramel, chocolate, some dark fruits.
Tastes of espresso, cocoa, dark chocate, some liquorice, some dark fruits, subtle vanilla.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes smooth, with a lot of coffee again, quite dry, medium roasty, a bit sweet, with cocoa, some lliquorice.

Very nice. Not very complex, even quite simple, but with lovely, distinctive coffee notes, especially in the nose. Drinks pretty smooth. Great beer for coffee lovers like me.

33 cl bottle. Batch #RED01. BBE 09.04.2016.
Pours black color with a small off-white head. Coffee and cocoa on the nose, roasted malts and dry hops. Malty flavor, dry dark chocolate, some coffee bitterness, short dry finish. Carbonation is medium, palate is chocolaty oily but bitter with coffee, there¬ís a fair amount of hops too. Nice, I especially like the coffee and roastiness here.
3425

Bottle from Theatre of Wine, Greenwich. Black pour with a tan head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee roast, raisin, woodsmoke. Smoky coffee flavour with a smidgen of dark chocolate and licorice. Smoky-sweet finish. Very good.
Bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is of roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. Taste is slightly sweet with lots of dark chocolate and espresso.
Bottle. Reddish tan head. Jet black body. Coffee, butter beans, chocolate, Marmite, vanilla and rum. Roasted bitter taste. Dry finish. Good.
Bottle at home, 26th December 15. Pours black and neat. Aroma is coffee, some chocolate. Palate is fairly thin, in line with the style. Good stuff

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Espa√±a.
A: Black / Negro.
T/S: Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate / Malta tostada, cafe, chocolate.

Botella 33 cl tomada en el momento en el kraken 05..12..2015. Lote B000146 hasta 08..09..2016. Color negro con espuma beige oscuro. Aromas y sabores intensos de caf√©s tostados y secos amargos al final. Achicorias. Cuerpo medio algo espumoso y denso con 7.4 vol que resulta ligeramente aspero. Buena. Habr√≠a que repetirla.
7.4%abv. Purchased in Gates West End. Coffee, chocolate and alcohol aroma, mocha and rich porter taste, bittersweet finish. Solid porter.

Keg @The Hanging Bat, Edinburgh. Pours black tan head. Nose is coffee and chocolate and that¬ís it, huge coffee and chocolate simple but very good. Taste is the same flavours, they just kept it simple and it tastes great.
Negro opaco, reflejos rojizos y espuma beis. Aromas de caramelo, toffee, caf√©. Cuerpo medio, sabor achocolaraso con final de amargor equilibrado y duradero acafetado.
Muy evidente la mocha tanto en nariz como en boca. Tomarla del tiempo mucho mejor.

empest Red Eye Flight
Aromma: Mocha, fresh gropund coffee, roast and chocolate.
Taste: Strong Coffee bitterness of fresh coffee and mocha tones, some roasted malts,cacao and a hint of black fruit in the back.
Medium body, average carbonation.

Good one for coffee lovers.
8/3/8/3/15=37

Aroma: intense filter coffee, some toasted malts. Appearance: black, medium, frothy, beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: turns slightly sweet, caramel, milk chocolate, then coffee comes up again, intensifies, turns bitter in the finish. Overall: excellent Porter, a bit too much coffee (and just that) in the aroma, but palate is very refined and complex. Bottle from Oddbins, Pimlico.
Bottle. Dark brown. Coffee and chocolate are the dominant flavours. Very well balanced and another fine beer from this brewery.
33cl bottle from cervezalandia. Dark color. Thin beige head. Medium body. Super dry finish. Flavour is super roasted, light malt, high coffee.

From trade wiht Douberd, many thanks! 33cl bottle. Pours very dark brown colour with a medium good lasting tan head. Aroma of chocolate, dark malts, some coffee, floral hops. Taste of floral hops, medium bitter, chocolate, roasted malt, some coffee, delicious!

(Tempest Red Eye Flight) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a shaler, ABV 7.4%
Black colour on the body, small thin beige head, disappearing striagt away.
Very nice aroma, lots of coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate, mocha, coffee grounds, amazing.
Great taste too, following the aroma, with fresh coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, light alcohol, mocha, roasted malts, light fruity touches.
Medium body, good carbonation, slightly sticky on the palate and mildly dry at the same time.
Unexpectedly nice, great beer.
bottle shared at van moll. poured a dark brown colour with a tanned head. nose of mocha, dark coffee, milk chocolate, caramel, and licorice. cacao, bit of a weak mouthfeel.

Bottle from de Molen Beershop, bacth RED01 BB 09 Apr 2016, large sample. Dark color, frothy brown head. Aroma of loads of coffee, roast, earthy. Bitter from malts and coffee, slight dry and roasty, some sweetness from chocolat and caramel. Bit too much on coffee in the nose, but nice combination in taste. Bit unbalanced. Ok, but im pretty surprised it scores a 100 in porter.

Bottle. Black pour, small brown head. Strong aroma of roasted espresso, earthy vanilla and cacao. Tastes like a cold espresso, strong coffee presence, with earthy cacao, mocha and a bitter dry finish. Good stuff.

Bottle, pours dark brown/black with a tan head. Aroma: mainly coffee beans, roast, bit of chocolate. Taste: Espresso, chocolate, hints of coconut(?), mocha, vanilla, hints of citrus. Medium sweet and bitter, creamy texture, full body, soft carbonation. Linger mocha finish. Lovely.
Bottle. Dark brown, tan head. Nice roasted coffee and hints of slightly burnt wood in aroma. Coffee, bitterness and notes of lushy licorice in taste. Good one.
some nasty black stuff at first and then some moccha/chocolat... goede bitter zoet balans, maar t rare (kruidige?) aroma verpest t n beetje voor me...

Bottle from St Albans beer shop, St Albans, Herts. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Roasty, malty, coffee aroma. Tastes roasty, malty, coffee, some chocolate, slight bitterness. This porter is all about the coffee, if it wasn¬ít so thin it would be world class, still a very good porter from Tempest.

Bottle @ Benzai¬ís 10K afterparty. Opaque dark brown to black color, small light brown head. Smell and taste malts, lightly coffee, some roast bitter and lightly liquorice. Only slightly cocoa and espresso. Average to medium body and carbonation.
Pours black with a sizeable brownish head. Aroma is coffee, cocoa and raisins. Taste is coffee, cocoa, slightly watery and a hint of overfly sugared coffee.
Bottle at home. Dark fruit and rich chocolate nose. Roast malt, plums and latte. Of course I love trumpets and book marks. Delicious :)

330ml bottle, pours almost black with a tan head. Aroma is mild, fruity coffee, chocolate malt, orange marmalade hop. Medium bodied, creamy texture some sweetness and light bitterness and good balance. Better and more complex with some time out of the fridge.

Bottle from Oddbins. Lovely dark colour. 
Mmm, this is very good. Intense coffee and chocolate. A beer to slowly sip and enjoy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours black with low frothy tan head. Aroma of chocolate and coffee, mocha really. Taste is balanced chocolate sweet and light coffee bitter in the finish. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.

From a 50 cl bottle in Edinburgh. 7.4% Imperial porter with cocoa and coffee.

A lot of coffee in the nose and faint dark chocolate. 
Creamy smooth with well hidden alcohol. 
Good balance in tasting despite the dominance of coffee in the nose.

New branded 33 bottle at home - 7.4%. Lovely deep brown/black colour with an off white tanny head. Aroma is clean and grassy, with light coffee and milky and bitter choc. Medium body, light carbonation. Liquorice, treacle, grass, dark choc... but it thin and lifeless with no punch. OK.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2016 Bottle. Pours almost black, beautiful brown velvety head. Nose is roasted coffee beans, espresso, and thats pretty much it, light sweetness in the background. Nice (if you like coffee). Taste is a bit thinner than aroma promises but strong espresso present, roasted malts, bitter chocolate. Light sweetness notto make it too dry - still not sweet. Very good.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is roasted coffee, chocolate, strong coffee taste and chocolate malt.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2016 Drank with Thijs 8-6-2014. Very strong coffee taste. A bit thin beer. Medium carbonation. Slightly watery aftertaste. 

Edit: rated higher after drinking with Rik and Lennart 20-6-2016 while watching Game of Thrones S06E09. Beer is not that thin. Coffee taste is full and good.

Bottle. Very dark brown with a beige head. Aromas are molasses and caramel with coffee and coal. Blackberry with woody, spicy notes and background toffee. Burnt toast with woody spices. Flavours are sweet toffee and chocolate with smooth coffee. Mixed dark berries with raisins and warming booze. Good strong porter.
Keg in the Bacchus, Newcastle. Pours black with a tan head. Bitter chocolate and coffee flavour. Beautiful lingering mocha finish.
Bottle at home on 13th March 2014. Pours a deep black colour with red hues on the periphery. Huge deep roasted coffee aroma and flavour. Excellent.
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text: Black. Thin head. Big coffee aroma, not much else. Smooth character, sweet chocolatey malts and a lot of coffee character.

Bottle from The Bottle Shop Canterbury, drunk at home. Dark brown almost black beer with a lasting tan head. Fuck loads of coffee on the aroma. Bad beer to have at 22.47 of an evening when you need to get some sleep as the caffeine in this smells pretty extreme. I love good coffee beers. And this is one of them. Sugar yes. Coffee yes. Wow. That¬ís a big slap of sugary espresso right in your face. Doesn¬ít make me any less drunk, just makes me wide eyed and goggled eyed. Well I may get some sleep in about 48 hours time after this, but I wouldn¬ít bet on it. Hilarious but hugely fun and only ¬£4.50 a bottle.

500ml bottle from The Beerhive. 
Big bubbly tan head, some good lacing. Dark black body. Rich chocolate nose, some citrus coming through. Big mocha flavour, a bit orange, berries on the finish. The mouthfeel is rich and creamy. Very light carbonation. No hint of the abv in drinking it. This beer is an absolute gem. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Wow. Massive coffee aroma with burnt notes and hint of vanilla with chocolate. Lots of carbonation accompanied by an unusually appropriate thinness. Amazing coffee bitterness which fills the mouth and leads to a dry vanilla flavour. An orgasmic mouthfull! Entrancing!

Bottle from Cornelius. This was the first Tempest I tasted way back and still my favourite. Pours pitch black with tan head. Massive roast coffee on the nose. Slightly burnt and woody taste, bitter with thickish mouth feel. Lovely finish, lovely beer.

Bottle from Cornelius. Black body with a large beige head that holds well. Excellent lacing. I could smell this the second I started pouring - gorgeous aroma of ash, Terry¬ís chocolate orange, wood smoke, espresso and Twiglets. Flavour of charcoal and a hint of spice and black chocolate. It¬ís very bitter and quite harsh. Medium body with a sticky mouthfeel. Average carbonation. A distinctive, flavoursome Porter. When I read that it was hopped with Simcoe and was 60 IBU, I was hoping for a hoppy Porter, verging on a Black IPA, but this is a Porter that¬ís very dry, ashy and challenging.

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. This is a dark brown-black beer that pours with a thin tan head. It has a very strong, rich floral coffee, chocolate and roasted flavour with a sweet liquorice, milk chocolate and spicy coffee finish.
Keg at Holyrood 9A, although at the end of quite long night... Have had in bottles before, and this was equally as good. A lovely, lovely beer.

On tap at Blue blazer dark brown with a foamy tan head nose is chocolate and coffee strong roasted malt backbone with a sweet expresso flavour bursting through sweet and smooth drinking a fine example of a coffee infused beer

A lovely couple of bottles of this from Cornelius on Easter Road in Edinburgh.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home (from Nina¬ís Mini Market, Edinburgh) - 19/12/12.
Light black with a thin tan head that quickly dissipates to the edge of the glass and leaves a film atop.
Nose is big mocha coffee, rich roast, really delivers the mission statement in this sense. Behind the dominant coffee theres a little roast malt, sweet sugary espresso.
The taste doesn¬ít match up to the nose however it delivers a solid coffee infused porter. Roast malt, bitter sweet dark sugar, espresso coffee, light chocolate.
Medium bodied, quite thin for a 7.4 % beer to be honest, soft carbonation, dry finish.
An excellent porter from Tempest.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: APR 12, 2014 Bottle nose of earth, bog , strong coffee and some spice. Thin but constant thin tan head, mediumx glossy black. IN the mouth there is some richness, cedar and port nerous coffee. Seemingly simple but really develips to in the class.

From cask at Cloisters. Pours dark brown with a small off white head. Aroma is deep amber with a small tan head. Smooth roasted malty, bitter and light herbal. Smooth roasted malty, lit liqourice and roasted dark malty. Bitter and slight herbal. Dry and bitter into the finish.

From the bottle. Pours flat without a head. Dark, almost black. Powerful aroma of coffee beans which always makes a beer smell slightly stale to me, but the is distinctly coffeeish, not off beer. The flavour is immediately slightly sweet at first with chocolate predominant over coffee. The balance becomes drier towards the finish. Damned fine stuff from the Kelso brewery.
Cask by handpump at Bon Accord, Glasgow - very dark brown nearly black, good tan head, sweet roasted malt and coffee aroma, coffee flavour, very smooth, full bodied, clean finish

Bottle at the Beer, Bocce and Boozer Tasting, London. Thanks, Paul, for this beer. Pours black-brown with a creamy, tan head. Big coffee nose, coffee ice cream, mocha. Medium sweet flavor with lots of dark and rich coffee, dark chocolate, ash, earth. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Medium sweet finish with some semi-dry, true coffee, mocha, moderate roast. A solid coffee beer. Very true coffee character.

Bottle from Royal Mile Whiskies, at London at Leighton¬ís Beer, Bocce and Boozer tasting. It pours very dark brown, with a thick light tan head. The nose is roasted malt, strong coffee, touch of lactose, chocolate, dark fruit (blackcurrant?) and toasted coconut. The taste is roasted malt, lots of rich-roast coffee, burnt malt, grainy, milk chocolate and toasted coconut, with a dry-roasted finish. Well hidden alcohol. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation. Well balanced and full of flavour. Delicious.

Bottle @ Beer, Bocce and Boozer tasting. Deep brown color with a big tan head. Big toasty nose, plenty of coffee. The taste is heavy coffee notes, bitter chocolate espresso finish. Coffee creamer. Obviously quite malty. Dry hoppy finish. Full bodies, lively. Overall, a very tasty beer from a great brewery.

Bottle 500ml.[ Courtesy of Benjii ]. Clear dark black brown colour with a average to large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolale, coffee, wood. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, mohca - coffee, chocolate. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120120]

10th February 2012Bottle shared by Evin and the the Kernel crew, Cheers! Clear dark brown beer, residual pale tan head. Smooth semi dry palate. Rich dark toffee malt with some coffee, a little lacto. Smooth semi dry finish. Trace of hop bitterness. Decent.

Bottle from Alesela
Black...good frothy tan head with good lacing
Aroma - smooth roasted malts..dark caramel malts...light smooth coffrr...get a sight hint of alcohol,,,some milk chocolate....aroma quite light
 Taste - roasted malts...milk chocolate...coffee...smooth malts. In the middle the coffee comes through more...good quality luxury coffee and smooth...no hops...well blended...no roughness. Not that overly complex but still a really good flavour.
Palate - soft carb...smooth..medium to full body. Finish same as main flavour with a mellow smooth coffee tail.
Overall - Elegant, well-blended, well-crafted porter with probably one of the best tastes of coffee i¬íve had in a beer so far - just gentle smooth and not overpowering (like in a mocha with the chocolate). Excellent stuff!
UPDATED: JAN 20, 2012 excellent mocha porter,sharp coffee flavour and good mouth feel.very smooth hop profile. no bitter notes.
first sip i got a strong coffee flavour followed by a smooth roasted flavour. As far as porters go, this one is highly recommended

[500ml bottle, Cornelius Beer&Wine] Black with a decent beige head. Aroma of coffee and dark roasted, slightly burnt, malt. Quite a full-on main flavour ¬ñ roasted coffee beans all the way. Grainy rather than smooth mouthfeel, long bitter finish ¬ñ which hides the alcohol reasonably well, all told. It¬ís a challenging beer, but one that¬ís ultimately highly rewarding [18122011]
Keg at Cloisters. Red-black with a thin, tan head. On the nose, black coffee, dark chocolate. Those two are there in the flavours, too, along with black fruit, almost a raisiny note. Very good.
From a bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is very metallic. Taste is rich, lots of chocolate and coffee. Full bodied, quite sweet
Dark brown with tan head and Fruity coffee nose. Rich coffee flavour with chocolate and slight citrus bitterness in the finish. Great coffee beer!

50cl bottle (my first bottle from this relatively young brewery though I¬íve had keg/cask before). Pours opaque black/mahogany with a very generous beige creamy head. The nose has freshly ground coffee beans and a green note which is closer to pistachios than anything else. As the head subsides there is a spice/vegetable note which I think is actually a mild green chilli pepper. The taste has a huge hit of that ground coffee and the green pepper and there is a nice layer of cream which glides over the top. The palate is medium to large in structure with a thick and creamy middle section texture and an elegant dry finish. Overall, this is a great beer - another excellent Scottish Porter.
Bottle from Cornelius. Pours very dark brown with decent tan head. Roast malt and coffee aroma. Coffee, roast and chocolate flavour. A very nice bitter espresso finish. A very good beer.
On tap @ The newly opened Brauadar. Very dark brown colour, not much head. Spicy malt aroma. Strong roasted coffee flavour, bitter aftertaste. Not bad.

In a bottle at The Caley. Pours a dark brown colour with a fair tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasty malt and liqueur chocolates. Bitter chocolate flavour with lovely espresso coffee and roasty malt again. Moderate carbonation and a little CO2 prickle. Very nice.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2013 Bottle at home ... deep brown ... big tan head ... dark cocholate ... light smokey charcoal roast nose ... big cocao ... soft milky coffee ... little too coffee for me.. 3.9

cask at the blazer ... deep black ... small tan head ... deep rich chocolate ... soft coffee nose ...dark sweet roast ... soft chocolate malts ...  almost a light chilli spice ....mellow smooth roast ... dark mocha roast ... soft silky ... crackin
Dark brown, almost black.  Good tan head. Aromas of coffee, vanilla,  Flavours of coffee, chocolate, vanilla.  Really nice beer.

Bottle. Pours deep dark brown with a nice tan head. Lovely coffee nose. Chocolate covered coffee bean flavour. Nice depth of flavour. Chocolate and coffee initially and then a lingering coffee bitterness. Very delicious.

Deep brown/black pour, medium light tan head that stays, leaving some lacing. Nose is big coffee grounds, hint of vanilla. Sweet chocolate palate, vanilla, hint of coffee grounds on a mild ashy bitter finish. Lovely stuff.
